item.description:
Interested in doing some hiking and seeing some of New England's beautiful fall foliage?  We'll drive from Alewife to Mount Monadnock, a 3,200 foot/1,000 m tall mountain in Southeast New Hampshire.

This is a very popular hike and the foliage should be near peak. For more information on Mount Monadnock, see: http://monadnocktrails.com/

The hike is average difficulty and takes about 4 hours roundtrip. The drive takes about 90 minutes each way. We expect to be back in Boston around 5 or 6 PM.

Please bring: water, lunch, and snacks for yourself; extra layers of warm clothing (it can be chilly on top of the mountain); and a camera if you like

Right now we have only two cars, so the passenger limit is 12 people, including the 2 drivers. If the trip fills up, please join the waiting list. If more people can drive, we will increase the limit of people who can come.

If you can drive and are willing to take passengers, please let me know.

If it rains on the 20th, we will postpone the trip. If the weather is uncertain, please check here for updates around 8 AM on the 20th.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet near the turnstiles about 9 AM on Saturday, 10/20.
item.name: Fall Foliage Hike: Mount Monadnock, NH
